name: Mixed Bag 39 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which one of the 3 Stooges' real name was Moses Horwitz?
questions.explanation:
Moe.

	Curly-Jerome Lester Horwitz, Larry-Louis Fienberg and Joe-Joe Besser.

questions.text: What was the name of Sir Francis Drake's ship?
questions.explanation:
The Golden Hind.

	Drake was an English navigator. He put in at an inlet now known as Drake's Bay which was located north of San Francisco.

questions.text: The famous Silvertown tire was made by what company?
questions.explanation:
Goodrich.

	In 1910 Goodrich made the first American cord type tire and called it the Silvertown.

questions.text: Which cigarette advertised 'What a difference a few cents make'?
questions.explanation:
Fatima.

	It was known as the Turkish blend cigarette. In 1913 the company that made them included baseball team cards with their packs and cartons.

questions.text: Who was the British prime minister noted for his appeasement of Hitler?
questions.explanation:
Chamberlain.

	His appeasement resulted in the Munich Pact of September 1938.

questions.text: What is the number of days in a fortnight plus the month of April?
questions.explanation:
44.

	A fortnight is 14 days plus the 30 days of April.

questions.text: What term describes the color of a horse that has white hair dotted with dark spots over all or part of his body?
questions.explanation:
Appaloosa.

	Developed by the Nez Perce people of northwest Oregon in the 18th century and named by a French trapper for the Palouse River.

questions.text: What shampoo called itself 'The beauty soap for your hair'?
questions.explanation:
Breck.

	Advertised by the Breck girls formed in 1937.

questions.text: Which of the following was ruled for 27 years by William Tubman?
questions.explanation:
Liberia.

	From 1943 to 1971. He was called the maker of modern Liberia.

questions.text: Whose father was a Missouri mule trader?
questions.explanation:
Truman.

	Truman was the 33rd president and the eldest of three children.
